text:
The idol of Baphomet, once worshipped long ago,
is world-renowned for its form pointing both up and down.

It is said: 'As above, so below;
as without, so within'—

Baphomet reflects on herself. Why did she come to this
Tokyo and choose the path of a school counselor?

In her home world, she was called both god and devil.
This was due to her power to see the desires of others and the methods to fulfill them.

Baphomet's 'Sacred Artifact' is ultimately quite simple.
She is well-versed in the cognition of the world and grants 'Inspirations',
divine revelations, to the intellects of others.

As the price for this, Baphomet received the limitless
'Faith' of the people, growing into a massive existence.

Baphomet can become anything if it is wished of her.
She becomes exactly what those around her believe her to be.

And it is precisely 'because of this' that Baphomet
is hopelessly unsuitable to become a leader of an organization.

Baphomet does not point in one specific direction.
She merely 'points in the direction the other party desires'.
She is unfit for leadership.

To a Baphomet who 'panders to others' in this way,
she herself does not know who she truly is.

In truth, for those who 'do not know dissatisfaction', and those who lack thereof,
a boundary between themselves and others will never emerge.

She has lived, wanting to know what she is.
Wanting to find that out— Perhaps that is what she became a counselor for.

Interfering with the 'inner devil' and granting 'Inspirations'.
Baphomet performs her usual work using these two primary powers.

Both are useful tools for a counselor.
However, there are cases where these powers are almost entirely ineffective.

First— Cases where she must handle
a complex and delicate 'inner devil'.

Adolescent desires sometimes manifest strongly as
self-destructive impulses that break oneself.

Interfering with a devil deeply tied to 'soft mental wounds' is difficult.
If one tries to force it, the cracked heart will shatter into pieces.

And second— Cases where the opponent is
someone with too little knowledge or experience.

Revelations, flashes of inspiration, are by no means born from nothing.
They use the resources already inside the client as material.

If there is a word to describe oneself,
but one does not know it, one cannot use it.

Even if Baphomet gives them that word, what comes out of
their mouth is 'nothing more than Baphomet's own words'.

In short, this 'Rule' is difficult to use on children.
To express one's self or one's wishes, one must know 'differences'.

It was especially powerless against children who had once left school,
left 'knowing things' behind, and lost their opportunities.
To them, the stimulation was too strong.

name: Baphomet
text:
And yet, I chose the path of a school counselor, followed the children who
left their schools, and ended up being worshipped there as well.

name: Baphomet
text:
This is what my nature— And my inner wishes, have led me to.
Everyone depends on me, and they become unable to live without me.

name: Baphomet
text:
And then the group becomes radicalized and extreme.
I can only ever become such an object of shallow worship.

name: Baphomet
text:
...Yes, I was able to become a temporary place of belonging for them.
I could grant them consolation as they demanded it.

name: Baphomet
text:
But shamefully, I find myself unable to do more than that.
However— If there were someone who 'rejected' me...

Chapter 3:
"Lullaby" for the Bad Boys

name: Kirito
text:
—I've already told you, that even if you put
me on it instead of Oniwaka-san, we wouldn't win.

name: Kirito
text:
If you're going to carry someone, it should be someone big and stupid...
Oops, I mean, someone with an empty head so you can pack more into it.

name: Kirito
text:
Baphomet-san's size is plenty.
...Though, for me, I don't need a replacement for Oniwaka-san.

On the first day of the festival, the Float Clash ultimately
ended in a victory for the Asakusa group, united under Sanat Kumara.

As for the Ikebukuro float carrying Kirito,
it fell faster than any other team, and was eliminated early on.

name: Kirito
text:
Baphomet-san is one thing, but I myself am powerless.
If you really wanted to win, you should have brought in someone else.

name: Kirito
text:
In a real fight, I'm weaker than anyone.
...Well, I also think it's pointless to get all worked up over a festival like this.

name: Color Gang
text:
But if Baphomet was a no-go,
we couldn't imagine anyone but you riding it, Kirito.

name: Color Gang
text:
Losing was frustrating, but this is fine in its own way.
Though... Maybe we shouldn't have been picky about our methods?

name: Color Gang
text:
Damn, I really wanted to go for the win!
Oh well, being able to participate with you was great, Kirito.

name: Kirito
text:
Seriously, why are you so fixated on me?
I was just the 'starting point' for you guys gathering.

name: Kirito
text:
The reason you guys are like this now is because
Baphomet-san came to underground Ikebukuro—

name: Color Gang
text:
But Kirito, you're like our family, right?
You're just like us hopeless people.
damn he got clocked :skull:

At those words, he stops speaking and ponders on something.
After a moment, Kirito turns his face away from the boys.

name: Kirito
text:
...
Anyway, I'm not participating anymore.

name: Color Gang
text:
Eh, what for!?
We're just about to get to the good part!

name: Kirito
text:
Don't make me say it over and over.
I told you I'm done with 'this kind of thing'.

name: Kirito
text:
Besides... Any group I get deeply
involved with always meets a terrible end.

Kirito leaves the area with those flat words—
However, there were those watching the whole scene from a distance.

name: Tomte
text:
Hmm... It seems they are indeed
'bad children' in the eyes of a Santa.

name: Tomte
text:
The investigation was delayed because they were children who had strayed
from their schools, but I've managed to add them to the list in time.

The large young man standing beside him mumbles a question,
a conflicted expression crossing his face.

name: Jack Frost
text:
...Hey, Tomte.
Are those kids really 'bad children'?

name: Tomte
text:
Yes, there's no doubt about it.
The judgment by my 'Sacred Artifact' is—

name: Jack Frost
text:
No, I know that much already.
You're reading the target's memories, after all.

name: Jack Frost
text:
But, what should I call it?
In reality, there's a gradation between white and black, right?

name: Tomte
text:
I see, I understand your question well, Jack.
In that sense, they are 'black close to gray'.

name: Tomte
text:
In other words, their apologies and atonement for their bad deeds are
not yet finished, or their confessions have not been completed.
Would that be a better explanation?

name: Tomte
text:
Or perhaps... The children themselves
believe that 'they are bad children'.

name: Tomte
text:
To add to that, they have memories of accumulating small,
self-aware bad deeds even before that attack incident.

name: Jack Frost
text:
...Well, a line has to be drawn somewhere.
Drawing a line is, in itself, a dry thing.

name: Jack Frost
text:
Since Santa's the one that separates white and black,
I'm not going to start nitpicking that now.

name: Jack Frost
text:
...But, y'know, isn't it possible for the results to change before Christmas?
Children are flexible and they change, right?

Tomte directs a straight gaze at Jack.
Eyes harboring a light similar to untainted fresh snow reflected Tomte himself.

name: Tomte
text:
—Jack, you really are kind.
I think that sentiment is something a Santa needs.

name: Jack Frost
text:
No, I mean.
I'm not particularly—

But Tomte shook his head somewhat sadly.
While it is easy to turn white to black, the reverse is—

name: Tomte
text:
...Unfortunately, I know almost no cases where the
results wavered in the short period until Christmas.

name: Tomte
text:
And perhaps that is why an existence like
a Black Santa is necessary for the children to reform.

name: Jack Frost
text:
...I see, you're right.
Sorry for forcing my way along.

name: Jack Frost
text:
I wanted to see your work, and I was a little
curious about the culprits of the attack incident.

name: Jack Frost
text:
Because, y'know, what kind of psychology'd lead those brats
to do something as stupid as attacking a Black Santa...

name: Child
text:
Aaaah—!
Hey, hey, look, Frosty is over there!!

name: Child
text:
Eh, no way!
Waaaah, is that the real one—!?

name: Jack Frost
text:
Oh, hi! I'm Frosty!
I've come to this winter brawl— Uh, festival, to see everyone!

Observing the Santas from the shadows was Kirito,
who had pretended to leave the area.

name: Kirito
text:
... 'Bad children', huh. It's only natural since we're 'doing
this precisely because we want to be thought of that way'—

name: Kirito
text:
It's only natural for bad deeds to be accompanied
by retribution, but 'Holy Ones' are surprisingly simple.

name: Kirito
text:
Even so, they really are stupid.
If they hadn't caused that attack incident, maybe
they could have avoided becoming 'bad children'.

name: Kirito
text:
But well, it doesn't matter to me anymore—
................

name: Kirito
text:
...Sigh, good grief. Fine.
I'll let Baphomet-san know, just in case.

name: Kirito
text:
Though, not letting them know would
probably be the real kindness.

And the next day— The second day of the Fighting Festival.
There, the 'Christmas Creative Food Stall Contest' was now underway.

Victory would be decided based on the prosperity of each group's stall,
their contribution to the festival, and the tasting evaluations by special judges.

name: Y'golonac
text:
Kabukicho's entry is a special sinful meal from an evil Santa—
The 'Decadent Snow Mountain Carbonara Fondue Pot'!

name: Y'golonac
text:
A trio of ham, bacon, and sausage!
Pile on the thick pasta and baguettes as you like!

name: Y'golonac
text:
And to finish, we dump a mountain of snow made of powdered cheese and butter!
Look, it's unusually stylish! Hihihi, shall we get lost in the snow together?

name: Y'golonac
text:
Profit be damned! The Christmas Creative Food Stall
Contest's winner will surely be the Kabukicho group~!!

name: Tetsuya
text:
If we end up in the red, you'd better clean up the mess?
But since food stalls are originally our business, we can't afford to lose.

The temptation of violent calories sneaking into the mental
gaps of 'it's okay since it's the end of the year'—
What it brings is the pleasure of deviation.

As customers gather with unsteady steps,
Y'golonac has already worn a triumphant smile.

name: Motosumi
text:
Hold your horses!! If you decide easily without even
seeing Asakusa's menu, don't say I didn't warn you!

name: Motosumi
text:
Our entry is a commoner-style, homey, yet creative
dish conceived by an uncle at Nakamise Street—
The 'Roast Chicken-Style Fried Chicken Bowl'!!

name: Motosumi
text:
On a fried chicken bowl seasoned with rosemary and garlic,
we pour plenty of gravy-like Japanese-style starch sauce!

name: Motosumi
text:
Heheh, we've added broccoli and cherry tomatoes,
and even the kids at Godoji will be happy to eat them with this seasoning!

A gentle dish that warms both body and soul in the freezing cold—
Customers attracted by the warmth reminiscent of a family gathering are flowing in.

name: Motosumi
text:
Heh, won't this one be ours? Following the Float Clash,
we in the Asakusa group will dominate this second round too!

name: Jinn
text:
Leave the cooking with fire to me!
I'll fry them all up crispy at super high heat!

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Umu, Asakusa will not lose in terms of heat!
I too shall sweat and face the cooking!

It seemed the two forces of Kabukicho and Asakusa had dominated the venue—
But just then, a cheer rose from the Shibamata stall.

name: Thunderbird
text:
Rum-flambéed spare ribs, gin-scented roast duck,
beer-braised beef stew— Why don't you take whichever you like, baby?

name: Thunderbird
text:
I'll even add an original hot mocktail if you want.
How about a Holy Night Hot Choco, or a Fireside Spiced Milk?

name: Ryota
text:
Uwaah, so many stylish items on the menu...!
They all look so delicious I might accidentally snack on them... *munch munch*

name: Hei Long Yi Quan
text:
Kon-pra~! Today I'm visiting Thunderbird-kun's cool,
limited-time Christmas food stall~!

name: Hei Long Yi Quan
text:
Will yours truly be able to conquer all the items!?
Everyone in '#GikensOwner', please cheer us on~!

name: Y'golonac
text:
Ptooie! That Thunderbird, not only did he join up with Shibamata,
but he's showing off with a flashy menu that's the total opposite of mine!?

name: Y'golonac
text:
And besides, all the Suidocho group members except for the Outlaws
are siding with Shibamata, aren't they? Despite being their friend, Uncle's being left out...!

name: Jagannath
text:
Man, things are really heating up today, huh?
All these dishes are perfect for this season, and they look delicious!

name: Jagannath
text:
Especially Y'golonac's pot, using that much butter...!?
...*gulp* Do I make today a cheat day!?

name: Jagannath
text:
Between you and me, I have a weakness for butter.
When I was a kid, I was always ste— I mean, tasting butter.

options.text: Did you almost say you were stealing it?
Officer, this man right here!
I'm arresting you on suspicion of theft.

name: Jagannath
text:
Wait, wait! That was back when I was a kid and
long before I came to Tokyo! It's past the statute of limitations!

name: Jagannath
text:
Ah, whatever. Anyway, today is peaceful!
There's no way a brawl will break out over a cooking competition.

options.text: Yesterday felt like an intense sports day.
Today's like a school festival.
So this is what Baphomet was talking about.

name: Jagannath
text:
That balance is the key to this Fighting Festival.
It's a way to get the police to approve of the rough programs.

name: Jagannath
text:
I think tomorrow is the main event, the 'Tag Match',
and the final day is the 'Deco-Float Decoration Contest', right?

options.text: I heard a rather dangerous name just now.
D-Deco-Float...?
Every day is packed!

name: Jagannath
text:
Heheh, I think you'll be able to see something pretty
intense tomorrow, fitting for the name 'Fighting Festival'?

name: Jagannath
text:
And on the day after that, we take the floats used in the clash on
the first day, decorate them with lights, and parade down the approach.

name: Jagannath
text:
I think making decorations and having stalls
might indeed feel like a school festival.
...Now then, I wonder how those guys are doing?

name: Color Gang
text:
W-Welcome!!
Our menu is Christmas-style yakisoba!

Star-shaped seaweed, and a color scheme using parsley and red pickled ginger.
While the effort was visible, compared to the other three shops—

options.text: It's cute, but lacking in creativity!
It really does feel like a student's school festival.
Their opponents are restaurant owners, what bad luck.

name: Jagannath
text:
Yoo, how's it going, brats?
Will you sell one yakisoba to your dear police officer?

name: Color Gang
text:
Geh, Jagannath! You again...
Can't you tell just by looking!?

Customer traffic is sparse, and it's hard to say they're prospering.
But precisely because of that, they can't afford to treat a rare customer poorly.

name: Color Gang
text:
(...Kirito said these guys were the ones preventing
the police headquarters from intervening in the festival.)

name: Color Gang
text:
(Maybe so. But we don't know what they're plotting,
so let's just avoid getting too involved...!)

name: Jagannath
text:
What's with all the whispering?
Are you going to give me a mountain of star-shaped seaweed as a service?

name: Color Gang
text:
Shut up! Like we'd ever do that for a cop!
Here, it's done, so just go away already!!

name: Jagannath
text:
Heheh, looks pretty good.
Well, I'm wishing you luck, brats. Do your best!

The delinquent officer, unfazed by the 'leave us alone' aura,
walked away with an aloof air. The children watched his back in stunned silence.

name: Jagannath
text:
Hmm, the taste isn't bad either.
Why don't you try some too, [Player]?

options.text: Ehehe, really?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Jagannath
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I'm a senior who's incredibly kind to my juniors.
...Well, at least half the time.
Alright, open wide!
The yakisoba, offered in an 'aahh' manner was simple, but could be evaluated as delicious.

options.text: (Consciously act a bit embarrassed)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Jagannath
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Heheh. Be careful—
If you give me that cute reaction, someone like me might want to give you a 'one-two' punch in the mouth?

options.text: ...No, I'm fine.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Jagannath
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Man, you're no fun~
Are you worried about people looking?
With this many people around, no one's gonna bother looking at us.

name: Jagannath
text:
Still, if there was someone who could guide them,
it would have been more of a contest. What a waste.

name: Jagannath
text:
But well, even if we tried to help, they'd probably just reject us.
Those guys don't have the room to accept anyone but 'family' yet.

name: Jagannath
text:
So what do we do? We need to approach
their head. If it's not us, then surely—

name: Jagannath
text:
They would surely listen to the words of someone
who's like a 'representative of their own circumstances'.

options.text: You're kind, Jagannath.
I'll go along with you, senior.
Why would you do that?

name: Jagannath
text:
Unfortunately, it's not that far out of idealism.
I'm doing this for a 'much more pressing' and deeply selfish reason.

name: Jagannath
text:
So, work as my right-hand man, dontcha'?
You look tougher than you seem, [Player].

Jagannath snorts, squaring his hands. He has always conducted
unconventional investigations alone, but this time is different.

He was uncharacteristically grateful for the upper management's decision
to buddy him up with [Player]. Just then, with somewhat impeccable timing—

name: Tajikarao
text:
Oh, so this is where you were!
[Player], and you too, Jagannath!

name: Oguchi Magami
text:
The two of you seem to have blended into the festival perfectly!
Are you currently on an undercover investigation? That's so cool!

options.text: Tajikarao, you look so cold...!?
Oguchi Magami, you're the same as usual.
The fact that we're police was exposed in seconds.

name: Jagannath
text:
Seriously, the police are showing up
in force two days in a row. What's going on?

name: Tajikarao
text:
We are off duty today!
We were notified to refrain from professional intervention!

name: Oguchi Magami
text:
The senior and I came half to enjoy
the festival, and half to cheer for [Player]!

name: Jagannath
text:
As expected of the rising star, people just won't leave you alone.
Anyway, you guys should have just rested properly on your day off.

name: Tajikarao
text:
Haha, at this time of year, we can't let our guard down anyway.
We're constantly on alert for the possibility of Hermes making a move!

name: Tajikarao
text:
Magami and I are prepared to chase our
fated rival, Phantom Thief Hermes, forever!!

options.text: It's starting to feel like a year-end tradition.
It seems a bit romantic?
I'm cheering for you two too!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Tajikarao
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I won't let my junior down!
Though for today, we're fully intent on calling a truce and enjoying the festival.

name: Tajikarao
text:
By the way, it's the second day of the festival... The third day, if you count
the pre-festival. Is the investigation proceeding properly?

name: Tajikarao
text:
As you know, headquarters is starting to get impatient. They're worried that
a festival lover like you might be neglecting the investigation to play around.

name: Jagannath
text:
...Good god, they're so impatient. We're just about to
go into their base and give them a good shock?

options.text: When did you find out where it was...!?
Ah, maybe from Baphomet—
So you 'were' working properly...

name: Jagannath
text:
So that's how it is. Tajikarao, Magami.
Keep an eye on the venue for a bit while we're gone!

name: Tajikarao
text:
Eh!? We have to do it!?
That's different from what you just said—

name: Suzuka
text:
Oh, if it isn't you, Tajikarao.
Why is a cop like you loitering around the Fighting Festival?

name: Suzuka
text:
Well, for an festival-loving guy like you, it's not strange seeing you show up...
If you're free, come help us out! And bring that puppy along too!

name: Tajikarao
text:
No, like I said,
we're off-duty— Hey!!?

name: Jagannath
text:
Alright, it's settled!
You guys, I'm counting on you!!

Having more or less forced the venue's security onto Tajikarao and the other,
the two drove the patrol car to a long-closed game center.

name: Jagannath
text:
—According to what I've heard,
they're hanging out in this abandoned building.

options.text: ...It's not a trap, right?
It's certainly a perfect place.
(Keep a lookout around the area)

name: Jagannath
text:
Well, you don't have to be so guarded.
If anything happens, I'll step up and protect you.

The inside of the building is in ruins. With every step on the way,
the debris and glass shards echoes with a dry sound. And then—

name: Color Gang
text:
—!? Cops!?
W-What are you doing here!?

name: Color Gang
text:
Damn, we let our guard down...
Are you here to catch us after all!?

The children couldn't hide their agitation at the sudden appearance of the police.
However, a dignified and beautiful voice immediately settled the room.

name: Baphomet
text:
Oh, Jagannath-sama and [Player]-sama.
I thought it might be about time you arrived.

name: Baphomet
text:
Please, have yourselves a seat on that sofa?
Would you like some warm rose black tea?

name: Jagannath
text:
Yeah, I've come to play.
I figured you 'wanted me to'.

name: Baphomet
text:
The fact that you came alone together indicates that
our interests are aligned— That is correct, is it not?

options.text: (Nod slightly)
We didn't come to catch you.
It depends on your next moves.

name: Baphomet
text:
Fufu... Now, you children go back to making the deco-float decorations.
I have some complicated adult talk with these people.

name: Baphomet
text:
Don't worry, I will not betray you.
...You understand that, right?

A few seconds after sending the children to the back with a bewitching smile—
Baphomet finally relaxed her shoulders and let out a small sigh.

name: Baphomet
text:
...Your insight was splendid, Jagannath-sama.
Shamefully, I have been 'earnestly' waiting for the two of you—

name: Jagannath
text:
Heheh, I thought so?
Now, let's hear the story while we have some chai.

White milk and sugar are poured into the black tea.
Stirred with a silver spoon, they soon melted into one.

name: Jagannath
text:
—I see. You were worried about these
stray children who dropped out of school.

name: Baphomet
text:
...Yes, and that was not for the sake of those children,
but shamefully, it was for my own personal motives.

name: Baphomet
text:
I want to know 'what happens after something is stopped'.
Because, I am 'one who was called a god and then ceased being a god'.

name: Baphomet
text:
I cannot define myself through the observation from within this world.
So I wanted to know 'how I would be seen by humans who have strayed from it'.

name: Baphomet
text:
To add to that, I also had a lingering attachment to
'people like that'— The heretics once called the Knights Templar.

name: Jagannath
text:
You got the info that they were gathering under Kirito,
visited the desolate streets of underground Ikebukuro,
and as a result, you were worshipped.

name: Jagannath
text:
But your 'Rule' is incompatible with kids.
Especially with immature, wounded kids like them.

name: Jagannath
text:
So you protected them, but you were unable
to do anything more for them— Is that it?

name: Baphomet
text:
Yes, I cannot change those children with my power.
Not unless they themselves wish to 'become something else'.

name: Baphomet
text:
Therefore, hoping for a change in those who had left school,
I decided to participate in this joint Fighting Festival.

options.text: So that plan isn't working out?
Do you want them to return to school?
So you really thought that you couldn't do anything else...?

name: Baphomet
text:
...Of course, a school just might not be everything.
Depending on the child, I would sometimes recommend the choice to leave school.

name: Baphomet
text:
However, most of those children are ones who need a 'school-like place'.
Children who originally had a chance to stay in school, but that didn't come true.

name: Baphomet
text:
Since I was the same, I understand...
What those children need.

While remembering her former place of belonging among the Templars,
Baphomet continues with a slightly distant look in her eyes.

name: Baphomet
text:
So, I wanted to at least give them a pseudo-experience of success at a school festival.
I thought it would also be a good opportunity to vent their pent-up energy.

name: Baphomet
text:
—Though, since they caused 'that incident',
you can say that it was a little too late...

options.text: That's just a 'hypothetical', right?
I don't think it's too late yet.
My senior will handle it for you.

name: Jagannath
text:
What's done is done. That's a simple fact,
but everything I'm about to list is also a fact.

name: Jagannath
text:
One, as long as I've arrived in my patrol car,
I won't let anyone say it was 'too late'.

name: Jagannath
text:
Two, I intend to deal
with this in stages.

name: Jagannath
text:
Three, justice naturally needs to be carried out, but in
doing so, we need to make judgments with the big picture in mind.

name: Jagannath
text:
Otherwise— It might lead to the 'worst
kind of tragedy' in this world.

Baphomet notices that Jagannath's unusually serious expression
and his golden eyes are looking back at a distant past.

And— It was in that shadow that Baphomet saw a light.
Those moist eyes... were indeed as alluring as those called devils.

name: Baphomet
text:
[Player]-sama, Jagannath-sama...
I want them to leave this temporary shelter of their own will.

name: Baphomet
text:
Due to my nature, shamefully, I am an object of awe.
It is very easy to make children obey me.

name: Baphomet
text:
If I tell them 'Go home' in a single word, they should obey.
But then— There is 'only the same future as mine once was'.

name: Jagannath
text:
I agree. 'Forcing' them into an
action isn't exactly a 'good' idea.

name: Jagannath
text:
They naturally have circumstances that forced them to leave their homes or schools.
Even if they return temporarily, they'll surely start wandering the streets again.

options.text: They seem like they'd rebel against it.
The current situation is much better than that.
If it were me, I'd just jump out somewhere else.

name: Baphomet
text:
And besides— If they feel they have been 'abandoned'
by me, their wounds will deepen even further.

name: Baphomet
text:
As a result, their 'devils' will run even further
away, leaving their futures behind.

name: Baphomet
text:
So, I can only simply be a place
for them to stay, just as they wish.

options.text: Baphomet...
Don't be so hard on yourself.
No one can be perfect.

name: Baphomet
text:
I was unable to do anything for Kirito-sama either.
He did not wish for anything from me... and that is scary.

options.text: Speaking of which, where is Kirito?
He's tough, isn't he? (spoken proudly)
I'll give him a hug next time I see him.

name: Baphomet
text:
...He left after providing me with the information that those
children had been designated 'bad children' by the Santa.

name: Baphomet
text:
'I'm done with playing family'—
What is hidden in those words is an obsession that any
organization he gets deeply involved with will be destroyed.

Baphomet narrows her eyes, like she was looking at a distant memory.
Unlike before, this time, Jagannath does not miss that shadow.

name: Baphomet
text:
...But honestly, I think Kirito-sama
is... an amazing child.

name: Baphomet
text:
I cannot put it into words well, but his small body
has a strength that is completely different from mine...
And a weakness that is similar to mine.

name: Baphomet
text:
Though if I were to say that to him,
I am sure he would hate it.

name: Baphomet
text:
And in a way, what Kirito-sama
says is also the truth.

name: Baphomet
text:
After all, there may be those who view this
place as a heretical witches' gathering, right?

A silence as heavy as lead weighed on their shoulders.
Only the cheap electronic sound from a game machine rang out, comically out of place.

name: Jagannath
text:
Alright, first, let's take things one by one.
Don't just say you can't do anything for them.
The first step is to just reach out.

name: Jagannath
text:
You said you were 'waiting' for us. It might be passive,
but I think you've already taken a step forward.

name: Jagannath
text:
Just leave everything to this delinquent cop duo!
We're going to make this pseudo-school festival a success!!

note:
option 1 and 3 have both Jagannath and Baphomet smiling at each other
as opposed to option 2 where she ends up looking worried

options.text: Don't lump me in with you!?
Leave it to us, YO!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Baphomet
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...Well then, I'm counting on you, I suppose?
(...I wonder if it'll really be okay?)

options.text: Alright, let's do this!!

name: Jagannath
text:
Yo, you little brats.
How's the Deco-Float decoration going?

name: Color Gang
text:
It's— exactly as it looks!
If you just came here to be sarcastic, then go home!

Jagannath and his partner show their faces at the workshop in the back of the game center.
Decorations in progress are scattered all around the area.

The overall picture is still nowhere to be seen,
and a sense of impatience is visible on the children's faces.
In short— The situation is not going well, to put it mildly.

options.text: Should your dear officer help out?
This looks pretty bad... doesn't it?
You're doing great, hang in there!

name: Color Gang
text:
We know we're in trouble!
I told you we're concentrating, so don't get in our way!

name: Baphomet
text:
Now, that is no way to speak to them. You have heard about
Jagannath-sama and his partner from Kirito-sama, have you not?

name: Baphomet
text:
The fact that he is protecting you from the police headquarters alone should
tell you that he is different from the tyrannical adults you know.

name: Color Gang
text:
I... I know that.
But we don't really need any help!

name: Jagannath
text:
Dumbo, there's no way a bunch of kids can win on their own.
I admire your spirit for trying, though.

name: Jagannath
text:
The other teams have money and technology, and Asakusa
even has professional carpenters on their side.
Didn't Kirito say last night, 'If you want to win, don't be picky about your methods'?

name: Jagannath
text:
I kinda agree to that. As long as you don't
break the rules, you can do whatever it takes.
In your case, getting help is the only way to make it 'fair'.

name: Color Gang
text:
Well, that might be true—
Wait, huh? How do you know what Kirito said?

name: Jagannath
text:
Because I was watching nearby, obviously.
He looked pretty down after losing that Float Clash.

name: Jagannath
text:
I didn't say anything to him then, of course.
Heh, I've got something called 'delicacy', y'know?

name: Color Gang
text:
The fact that you're saying that means you have no delicacy at all!
Anyway, we don't need help from some high-and-mighty adult!

name: Color Gang
text:
Just get out! I can't concentrate...
And I'm sorry, but Baphomet, don't come here too often either!

Practically kicked out, Player and the others return
to the entrance area to discuss the situation further.

options.text: I knew it would end up like this...
They really seem to hate the idea of asking for help.
It's exactly as Jinn-sensei said.

name: Baphomet
text:
Those children even dislike accepting help
from me when it comes to making the decorations.
And when it comes to outsiders, that rejection is only stronger.

name: Baphomet
text:
They are that determined to win on their own.
I wish they would also learn how to accept help from others...

name: Baphomet
text:
...I thought their unity through participating in the festival
would be enough, but perhaps I am the one who has become greedy.

name: Jagannath
text:
To be honest, I'm not sure why they don't want your help,
but it might not be that they 'don't want any help from adults' in general.

name: Baphomet
text:
...?
What... do you mean by that?

options.text: (Recall the statement earlier)
They said they didn't want help from 'arrogant' adults, right?
I see, so that's it.

name: Jagannath
text:
Yeah, that's right. It's only natural for them to be annoyed
by high-and-mighty adults who talk down to them.

name: Jagannath
text:
In any case, their slip of the tongue about not wanting 'arrogant adults'
is a sign that they might accept help from 'someone who isn't like that'.

name: Jagannath
text:
Then let's bring in the right assistants as they wish.
Someone who's an expert in the field, isn't arrogant,
and can see things from the same perspective as those kids.

options.text: I'm confident in my connections.
Senior, it's my turn to shine!
Someone that convenient... might actually exist.

name: Jagannath
text:
Oh? Aren't you the reliable one!? I also have an acquaintance who's
well-versed in electrical decorations and that kind of stuff.

name: Jagannath
text:
He helped me out with construction and various things back home.
He's like a kid who's obsessed with technology, so they shouldn't push him away.

About an hour later, two people appear at the
entrance of the abandoned building. The first one is—

name: Jagannath
text:
So, this is my 'former' fellow countryman, Tvastar.
He's a bio-engineer, but he's also dependable when it comes to electricity and structures.

name: Tvastar
text:
Well, if it's Jagannath-kun asking, I guess I have no choice.
Besides, we're 'modifying existing materials', right? I'm getting 'thrilled'!

options.text: Long time no see, Tvastar!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Tvastar
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Yahoo! I heard, [Player]-kun.
So you're buddies with Jagannath-kun now?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Tvastar
dialogue_after_selection.text:
How nice, how nice!
I'm always looking for assistants, disciples, or 'buddies' for my workshop!

options.text: Keep the 'mad' modifications in check, okay!?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Tvastar
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...I know! But super flashy lighting is okay, right?
I'm great at that kind of thing!

options.text: Is Jagan already modified too...!?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Tvastar
dialogue_after_selection.text:
No, no, of course not.
Jagannath-kun is very skilled, you see.
He already had a mode-switching function even before I added anything...

dialogue_after_selection.name: Tvastar
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Oh, but the 'Sacred Artifacts' on his arms have different shapes, right?
I actually made various adjustments around there...

name: Baphomet
text:
As expected of your choice, Jagannath-sama.
Tvastar-sama, it is a pleasure to meet you.

name: Tvastar
text:
The pleasure is mine! Those wings and horns seem like great modifications~
...Wait, they aren't modifications? Then I want you to tell me more about yourself!

name: Baphomet
text:
I do not understand myself enough to teach others...
However— I am curious as to how I appear in your eyes.

Baphomet somehow manages to suppress her swelling desire
and consciously steers the conversation back on track.

name: Baphomet
text:
And this person brought
by [Player]-sama is—?

Jagannath gives a rare wry smile at the question.
The person in his sights is 'for better or worse' too perfect.

name: Jagannath
text:
Geez, what a choice you made. I don't know if you're
bold or what, but you come up with the craziest things.

name: Jagannath
text:
True, he's a good fit in terms of character and creative direction.
Except― For the fact that he's a 'student of the Santa School', that is.

name: Jack Frost
text:
Aah, I'm Jack Frost, student from Santa School.
I'm pretty confident when it comes to street-style designs.

Baphomet is speechless. It's only natural, as the person
standing here is essentially the same as 'the person the children attacked'.

name: Baphomet
text:
[Player]-sama. I do not mean to
doubt you, but why on earth did you—

options.text: It's okay, Jack is a bad boy too.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Jack Frost
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Hey.
I know that's why you called me, but what kind of introduction is that, [Player]?

options.text: I called him as a 'senior' bad boy.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Jack Frost
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Hey.
I know that's why you called me, but what kind of introduction is that, [Player]?

options.text: He's actually an amazing artist!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Jack Frost
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Hey, stop it! You're embarrassing me...
(I didn't know they thought about me like that...!?)

name: Jack Frost
text:
Just so we're clear, I took this job because I thought it was
suited for me, regardless of my position as a Santa or whatever.

name: Jagannath
text:
Haha, you're really something for accepting it.
Besides, aren't you at your busiest right now?

name: Jack Frost
text:
Yeah. So do keep it a secret from the other Santas
and those brats that a delinquent Santa is here.

name: Jack Frost
text:
If they find out I'm slacking off to
do this, even I'll get punished, you know?

name: Jack Frost
text:
And in return... It would be great if you kind police officers
could pull some strings to get permission for the graffiti.

name: Jagannath
text:
No problem. I personally like your graffiti.
It reminds me of the flashy festivals back home
where we throw colored powder at each other.

The two of them, both having a 'hidden' side, likely share a connection.
The big 'bad boys' exchange glances and laugh as if they were sharing a secret crime.

options.text: I feel like you're two of a kind.
A collaboration between a delinquent cop and a delinquent Santa!
A double-life duo!!

name: Baphomet
text:
...Jack Frost-sama.
May I, ask you one thing?

name: Jack Frost
text:
Hmm, what? Uh—
You were Baphomet-san, yes?

name: Baphomet
text:
I heard those children were designated as 'bad children' by the Santas.
That means you have touched into their memories, have you not?

name: Baphomet
text:
In other words, you know for a fact that the incident
was not just 'suspicion'. ...And yet, you are cooperating?

Jack hesitates. He is being doubted right now.
'Are you not a spy for the Santa School?'

And because of that, Jack decides to reveal his true feelings.
After all— He is a 'delinquent' when it comes to being a Santa.

name: Jack Frost
text:
I... feel like I wanted to
challenge that 'bad boy judgment'.

The words that follow that single sentence are, to put it simply,
a monologue from someone standing on the 'delinquent' side.

name: Baphomet
text:
—Challenge the 'bad boy judgment'?
What could you mean by that?

name: Jack Frost
text:
Truth is, I was at the scene of that judgment.
I guess I felt like rebelling... It's a bit 'worth doing as art'.

For Jack Frost, the 'fairy who draws frost graffiti on walls',
art has been an illegal act since birth.

name: Jack Frost
text:
In reality, it's absolutely necessary to 'atone' for what they've done.
But for a Santa, shouldn't it be different?

name: Jack Frost
text:
That's how I felt— Because, you know, kids make mistakes all the time
when it comes to the methods they use to express their heart's cry, right?

name: Baphomet
text:
...
Jack-sama...

options.text: Jack was 'like that' too, after all.
I'm glad I called you, Jack.
Jack really is great...

name: Jack Frost
text:
I'm just someone who happened to be 'evaluated'.
Otherwise, my graffiti would've been erased from society too.

name: Jack Frost
text:
That's why— It's my turn next.
It's art, isn't it, [Player]?

'I'm not very good at expressing things in words, but I hope it got through'—
He continues 'earnestly' while he examines Baphomet's expression.

name: Jack Frost
text:
Santas give blessings, and Black Santas give punishments.
They look like polar opposites, but they're both for the sake of the children.

name: Jack Frost
text:
What I'm trying to do now isn't white or black work,
but I thought it might be okay to have a heretical Santa like that.

name: Jack Frost
text:
I mean, I have no objection to drawing the line between white and black.
But— I'm a 'bad boy', so I'm exploring my own way.

name: Jagannath
text:
Heheh, to be honest, this is the best choice we could have.
I've gotta give you some major credit, [Player]!

name: Jagannath
text:
But seriously, is it really okay to do such a solo performance?
From the Santa School's perspective, it's pretty close to an act of betrayal, isn't it?

name: Jack Frost
text:
Actually, I already got permission from the Principal. In fact, it's the
Principal who's stopping the 'criminal evidence' from being passed to the police.

name: Jack Frost
text:
The white Principal said new challenges are necessary for the
new generation of Santas, and he was happy about my initiative.

name: Jack Frost
text:
The black Principal also felt like 'his' workload won't disappear anyway,
so he'd be grateful if it could be reduced.

name: Jack Frost
text:
But well, to be honest, I think the fact that it's an
incident you and [Player] are handling is a big factor?

options.text: It's not just that.
A lot of people are cooperating.
It feels like everyone is stepping slightly out of their 'line of work'.

name: Baphomet
text:
...'those children can change'.
In other words, you believe in that too?

name: Jagannath
text:
Well, yeah. People can change.
That's my current belief, especially when it comes to kids.

name: Jagannath
text:
For that to happen, the adults around them shouldn't give up.
No matter how 'unjust' they are, or if they've given up on themselves.

name: Jagannath
text:
Heh, I'm the living proof of that.
I used to be quite the brat back in the day, y'know?

name: Jack Frost
text:
The fact that they were designated 'bad children' by a Santa's power
means that right now, they are 'bad children' as 'a temporary state'.

name: Jack Frost
text:
But like Jagannath said, kids can change.
That's why Black Santas exist, after all.

name: Tvastar
text:
Hmm, it sounds like quite a task... But I'm here too,
so it's okay! Because I'm great at 'modifying' things!

name: Tvastar
text:
—So! What kind of functions do you want?
My suggestion is, hmm, let's see...

name: Tvastar
text:
Oh!! How about incorporating a synapse conduction circuit and
controlling the lighting patterns with the rider's brainwaves?

name: Tvastar
text:
Like having the electrical decorations 'blink' intensely when the
adrenaline levels rise! I think a neural interface would be interesting~!

name: All Four
text: (W-What's with this guy~~~!!?)

Overwhelmed by Tvastar's personality and momentum,
the children are too intimidated to even reject him.

name: Color Gang
text:
Seriously, what is he... a giant child?
Is he one of those 'mad scientist' types!?

name: Color Gang
text:
Jagannath and [Player]'s acquaintance is freaking scary...
But, maybe they are a little interesting?

name: Color Gang
text:
And, this big, super cool polar bear
brother who looks like a 'bad boy'...

name: Jack Frost
text:
I'm Jack Frost, nice to meet ya.
If you'd like, you can count on me for anything related to the design.

name: Jack Frost
text:
I'm an artist who's doing pretty well for myself.
I think I can create a slightly 'badass' design that's to your liking?

Jack shakes his color spray can and runs a line without hesitation.
Voices of admiration rise at the impromptu graffiti that appears on the wall.

name: Color Gang
text:
(I-I've seen it so many times, I know!
This person is... That mysterious graffiti artist...!)

name: Jack Frost
text:
Hmm? What's wrong? If you want,
could you tell me what kind of thing you'd like to create?

name: Color Gang
text:
Ah. Uh. Well, that— I have an image in mind,
but it's hard to put into words...

name: Jack Frost
text:
It's okay, I started from there too,
so a vague image is perfectly fine.

name: Jack Frost
text:
Just try telling me about it.
It'll be my job to capture that properly.

name: Color Gang
text:
—I-I understand!!
Well then, um...

The boy glaces at Baphomet and whispers into
Jack's ear so the others can't hear.

name: Jack Frost
text:
Ah, yeah. I see... Could it be that—
It's actually something like this?

Jack whispers back.
The boy's expression instantly brightens with joy.

name: Color Gang
text:
—!!
H-How did you know!?

name: Jack Frost
text:
Haha, I told you, didn't I?
I am an artist, after all.

name: Tvastar
text:
Wait, what is it!?
I want to know too, I want to know—!!

The 'Transient' Jack Frost draws as
smoothly as frost spreading, sharing the image.

name: Tvastar
text:
—I see, I see.
So that's how it is! Nice, I like it!

name: Tvastar
text:
In that case, instead of LEDs, how about using genetically modified
light-emitting organs for 'bioluminescence'~? ATP-driven is eco-friendly!

name: Jack Frost
text:
Whoa whoa, for real...?
Well, it's a bit out there, but I guess that's an option?

options.text: Jack, you're really acting like a big brother~
As expected, Tva-bro is indeed reliable.
Ugh, I feel so left out...!

text:
As the two assistants interact with the children,
Baphomet watches as she is taken aback.

name: Baphomet
text:
My... For those children to
open their hearts so quickly...

name: Jagannath
text:
Heheh, it might be their compatibility with Jack and Tvastar,
but it just shows how much they had inside that they couldn't put into words.

name: Baphomet
text:
...I'm glad. This is something
that I cannot do, after all.

A faint smile of relief and a gentle gaze are tinged with a slight envy.
Only the delinquent officer standing by her side notices this.

name: Jagannath
text:
...Isn't that just
a 'belief' of yours?

name: Baphomet
text: —Eh?

name: Jagannath
text:
No, 'sorry'. I spoke as if I knew it all.
You are who you are because of your own experiences. But, y'know—

name: Jagannath
text:
It might be unavoidable for you to be 'worshipped',
but I feel like it's okay for you to 'descend' to the kids a bit more—

name: Jagannath
text:
It's also fun to crouch down and meet their gaze.
If your high-level attacks don't land, then fight them on a low level!

name: Baphomet
text:
...
Descend to where the children are...

Baphomet repeats the unexpected words.
Just then, the two who had left the circle of children approach.

name: Jack Frost
text:
Say, Baphomet-san. Could you leave things
to us and the children from here on out?

name: Tvastar
text:
Heheheh, it seems they don't want
to show it until it's finished!

name: Baphomet
text:
...I understand. I leave them in your hands with my full trust.
Please— Take good care of these children.

Jagannath watches her as she bows 'respectfully'
his expression thoughtful. And then—

name: Jagannath
text:
...Alright! Then let's leave this to
them and head toward the festival venue.

name: Jagannath
text:
Baphomet. [Player] has also called in some help for the food
stalls, but they probably need your strength over there.

name: Jagannath
text:
But— Before that, I do have
one other request for you.

Like a brat who has just thought of the ultimate prank,
Jagannath breaks into a charming, full-faced smile.

name: Jagannath
text:
Hmm? Don't be so guarded, it's not like it's anything difficult.
I just want you to call Kirito back for a bit, alright?

The scene changes to the chaotic festival venue.
At the Ikebukuro food stall, where the color gangs are stationed—

name: Choji
text:
W-What should I do~!?
This is completely different from what I was told!

name: Color Gang
text:
Hah!? We wasn't told about any of these either.
Besides, we don't need help!!

name: Ryota
text:
B-But... You were called by [Player], right?
Everyone from Ikebukuro, please listen to what Choji has to say!

name: Color Gang
text:
Stay out of this, you Shibamata bunch!
We're the Ikebukuro gang, you got that!?

name: Ryota
text:
O-Of course I know that, but I'm asking you nicely...
夜路詩句!!

name: Color Gang
text:
Wait, shouldn't that be '夜露死苦'?
What's with those poetic kanji, you honor student!?

Ryota tried using yankee ateji kanji but that failed miserably
instead of the typical 夜露死苦 (yoroshiku / night-dew-death-suffer),
he used 夜路詩句 (also yoroshiku, but night-road-poetic-verse)

name: Ryota
text:
My grades aren't as good as the President's!
Waaaaah, [Player], come quickly—!!

As if hearing the call like a hero,
[Player] arrives on the scene at just the right time.

options.text: S-Sorry for the wait~!
Things don't look like they're going well over here.
I've come to help, everyone!

name: Ryota
text:
[Player], you really came!? I'm sorry,
things didn't go well even though you left them to me...

name: Color Gang
text:
We weren't waiting, and we didn't call for you—
...Wait, Baphomet's with you?

name: Baphomet
text:
Yes, I have also come to help with the 'stall'.
It is all right for me to participate if it is not for the decorations, no?

name: Color Gang
text:
Well... That's fine, or rather, we're happy that you're here to help.
But Kirito's gone now, and shouldn't someone be at the hideout?

name: Baphomet
text:
Ufufu, there is no problem.
At our base, we have some very reliable help right now.

name: Baphomet
text:
Introduced by [Player]-sama and their partner,
they are producing the decorations for our Deco-Float.

The children are shaken by the shocking news.
They find it hard to believe that the decoration team would actually accept help.

name: Baphomet
text:
I have decided to trust Jagannath-sama and his partner.
And you? ...You want to win this festival, do you not?

The children exchange glances with each other, flinching.
They had long known that they couldn't go on like this.

name: Color Gang
text:
Alright. Baphomet, if you trust them, then we will too.
Or rather— We trust you, Baphomet, because you trusted them.

note:
I hope that sentence wasn't confusing
it's basically 'we trust them because you do' to 'we trust in your judgment of them'

options.text: ...It looks like we can manage!
Choji, tell me the current situation.
Is there anything I can help with too?

name: Choji
text:
Sorry, [Player]. Actually, we haven't even decided what to
make yet. I tried asking them what they'd like...

name: Color Gang
text:
Hah!? Even if you say that, we don't
know what kind of menu could beat those guys!

name: Choji
text:
True, to catch up with the other teams now,
we'll need a menu that's really eye-catching...

name: Jagannath
text:
...Then, how about something like poda pitha?
Well, it's just a thought, or rather, it's a favorite of mine.

name: Jagannath
text:
We also have a big 'festival' in my hometown, and they serve that dish there.
I thought it might be something unusual for Tokyo.
poda pitha: traditional slow-cooked rice cake from India, typically served during festivals,<br?and used to be served to Lord Jagannath of all people

name: Choji
text: ...That could work!!

name: Choji
text:
I believe, it's a rice-flour dish similar to pizza?
I can figure out the recipe even without using my 'Sacred Artifact',
and both 'salty' and 'sweet' versions should work.

name: Choji
text:
But, in this short time, I wonder how much of a Christmas
arrangement... suitable for this season and festival we can make?

name: Baphomet
text:
—! I see, so this is why Jagannath-sama
have asked for my strength!

name: Baphomet
text:
Please allow me to assist you in drawing out the possibilities
dwelling within you, for that of which we call revelations!

name: Baphomet
text:
Choji-sama, may I have your hand?
Let us begin our on-site counseling!
「Billowing Banquet」——Sabbatic Orgy!!

Flames of 'wisdom' overflow from the necklace hanging at her chest,
eventually forming a small crown-like shape above her head.

The flickering flames, which also look like a pink aura,
travel through her hands and envelop Choji's entire body.

name: Choji
text:
T-This is—!?
Ideas are popping into my head one after another!

name: Choji
text:
For the 'sweet' ones, let's bake the dough thin like a crepe.
Regardless of the filling, it might look lovely if we sprinkle some powdered sugar.

name: Choji
text:
For the 'savory' ones—
One idea is to make them pizza-style, decorated
in Christmas colors with tomato, basil, and mozzarella.

name: Choji
text:
Yes. This should be perfect for an interesting 'midwinter festival' dish.
Not only that, the texture will be interesting too!

name: Choji
text:
Now, this is everyone's food stall, so you'll help me, right?
I'll teach you how to make it and plate it, so let's cook together!

Overpowered by Choji's sudden awakening, the children follow him like
'hatchlings' following a mother bird, and begin working by imitating his actions.

name: Color Gang
text:
Incredible...
I thought he looked unreliable, but he's a real pro...

name: Color Gang
text:
Or rather... So this is Baphomet's 'true' power.
It didn't work like this when she tried it on us before.

name: Color Gang
text:
It's because we don't have the foundation of knowledge or experience...
But, if we do gain those things, then even we could—?

Baphomet affirms the shown possibility with a smile.
Hope instantly shines in the children's eyes.

name: Baphomet
text:
...Jagannath-sama, thank you. Fufu, I wonder just
how far those 'keen eyes' of yours could see.

name: Baphomet
text:
My 'Rule' indeed shows its maximum power when
used on a professional in their field. To think that you...

name: Jagannath
text:
You're overestimating me. I didn't know the details of your 'Rule'.
This was just a coincidence. After all, the one I wanted to do something about was—

Like a detective pointing at a culprit, he thrusts out his finger.
The person at the end of it was none other than Baphomet herself.

name: Jagannath
text:
From what I've heard, you have a habit
of behaving as others want you to, right?

name: Jagannath
text:
And, you've convinced yourself that you're
helping those kids because they asked for your help.

name: Jagannath
text:
Your own feelings are completely missing from that, aren't they?
If you hadn't been asked, would you have not even glanced at them?

options.text: The fact that you visited Ikebukuro is the ultimate proof.
The desire to help must have been there from the start.
Baphomet, it's alright for you to 'want to be helped' too.

name: Jagannath
text:
Exactly, that's some good work you've got, [Player]!
In short, you haven't realized your own feelings.

name: Jagannath
text:
Haha, it's like a doctor that can't heal himself.
That's what happens when you're always peeking at the 'devil' inside others.

name: Jagannath
text:
—Now, Baphomet, what is it that you want to do?
These kids have already trusted you, and they've taken a step forward.

name: Baphomet
text:
What...
I want to do...

Before her eyes, the children, spurred on
by Choji, are busily engrossed in their work.

name: Choji
text:
Everyone, don't just stand around, help out!
You stir the dough, and you over there, prepare the sauce!

name: Color Gang
text:
Eh, ah, okay! Wait, his character changes
way too much when he flips the switch!?

name: Color Gang
text:
Alright, this is exactly what we want.
It's our chance to show Baphomet our good side!

It was an incredibly dazzling sight. I have given up,
because I thought that I could never lead the children like he did.

name: Baphomet
text:
(I am a disgusting person, who would even use the situation where I am
worshipped and just responding to demands to satisfy my own desires...)

name: Baphomet
text:
(I am a shameful existence who can do nothing but that.
But if there is even the slightest possibility that I am not, then I...)

She raises her head, and the sight of the children jumps into her view.
Immediately after, her mouth moves before she can think.

name: Baphomet
text: ...Do your best.

name: All Three
text: —Eh?

A small single word whispered in a small voice.
It becomes the trigger, and the words flow out as if a 'dam' was broken.

name: Baphomet
text:
Please, do your very best. Even if you do not see the
answer right away, or if you cannot find your next place to belong to.

name: Baphomet
text:
For now, please have as many wonderful experiences as you can with me,
and become people who can voice even one wish of your own.

name: Baphomet
text:
If you can do such a thing...
I am willing to do anything, as shallow as I am.

The words spoken by Baphomet, who only fails to 'understand' herself,
seep into the children's hearts with a certain persuasiveness.

name: Baphomet
text:
I might not be able to change you,
or find your next place of belonging at all.

name: Baphomet
text:
And above all, you likely do not
wish for me to do such things.

name: Baphomet
text:
But, you know, I find you all so very dear.
So... I desperately want to be of help to you.

name: Baphomet
text:
So, it is not for your own sake.
As shallow as it may be... It is for my own.

The children had likely never seen
Baphomet reveal her 'emotions' to this extent—

Baphomet walks up to them while they are bewildered,
and immediately starts helping with the food stall dishes.

name: Color Gang
text:
W-What's wrong, Baphomet?
You're our symbol, after all...

name: Baphomet
text:
I am doing this because I want to.
I want to be of help to you, but was I in the way?

name: Color Gang
text:
T-That's not it at all!
I mean, I've never once thought you were in the way!

name: Baphomet
text:
Then let us do our very best— And with everyone else right now.
That will surely become an irreplaceable asset for you one day.

name: Jagannath
text:
Yes! That's 'Karma Yoga'!
Do not be attached to the results, just take your own actions!
Karma Yoga: path of selfless action, doing duties without attachment to personal gain

name: Jagannath
text:
Forget about what you can or can't do for a moment.
Ask your heart what you yourself want to do— And concentrate!

options.text: Let's all do our best!
'Let's cooking'!
I'm not good at cooking, but I'll try my best.

text:
Thus, the Ikebukuro stall makes a rapid comeback.
Its aroma drifts around, and the number of customers increases rapidly.

name: Y'golonac
text:
What, what!? The customers are suddenly being
stolen away from Uncle's place... Jagan, what did you do!?

name: Jagannath
text:
Why are you assuming I did something?
I just gave them a little nudge, the rest is their own hard work, y'know?

name: Jinn
text:
[Player], you did a good job. How do I know that?
Because it's only natural that I'd find myself glancing over out of concern!

name: Jinn
text:
That Jagannath guy is doing quite well too...
Could it be that he's more suited to be a teacher than me—
No, no, that can't be!

name: Jinn
text:
But, the wall of those brats that I thought would be difficult to connect with...
That guy broke it down so easily... *mumble mumble*.

options.text: Whoops, he's gone into his own world.
Jinn-sensei, you're a good teacher too!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Jinn
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I-Is that so!?
If you say so...
But don't be too quick to decide, no matter how good a senior officer he is!

options.text: So do you accept my senior and the police now?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Jinn
dialogue_after_selection.text:
N-Not yet! He should be able to do at least that—
Otherwise, I won't be able to send you off if you ever choose to leave Shinjuku!

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Hahaha! You truly are my rival, Jagannath!
I was secretly worried about you, but you've handled things well.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
And you too, Baphomet.
Your face looks more full of life than before too, doesn't it?

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
To move not because you were asked, but because you desire it—
I've just recently experienced the joy of that,
and the happy coincidence of both parties' feelings!

name: Baphomet
text:
Oh...? It seems there has indeed been a major change
in your inner world since the previous incident, Sanat Kumara-sama?

name: Baphomet
text:
Fufufu, I am very interested.
Will you finally let me peek at your 'devils'?

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
—!?
No, I'd like to resolutely refuse that!

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
If it's a mutual spiritual communication, then perhaps...
No, that...! Ggh, you truly are my rival as well...!!

name: Jagannath
text:
Heheh, so you've returned to your usual self?
I guess that's who you originally were, right?

name: Baphomet
text:
I wonder... how that may be?
Shamefully, I do not understand myself.

name: Baphomet
text:
But, I at least know what
it is that I wanted right now.

name: Baphomet
text:
Now that it has come to this, I shall do whatever I can!!
Fufufu, everyone in the venue, could you please gather over here?

name: Baphomet
text:
Ah, but I will be in trouble if I attract too much attention.
Then I will just keep getting bigger and bigger, aaaah—!
very interesting marketing campaign

Whether for better or for worse, Baphomet and the children's stall, which had drawn
immense attention, was now recording an overwhelming turnout of customers.

name: Baphomet
text:
Oh my. How embarrassing.
To think you would look at 'me' with such eyes smeared in desire—!

name: All Three
text:
B-Baphomet...
She's h-huge—!?

name: Baphomet
text:
But if it is for the sake of these children...
No matter how 'shameless' it may be, I want to be their strength—!

name: Baphomet
text:
Now, everyone—! Anyone who wishes to satisfy
their hunger, please come to our stall!

name: Otherworldly Ruler?
text:
What is that... A giant humanoid 'float'...
No, is it the real thing!? And it smells amazing...?

Between the unleashed, off-the-charts charm of Baphomet and the
synergistic effect of Choji's creative cooking, customers continued to swarm in.

name: Y'golonac
text:
This is really bad—!
We were definitely the most popular just a moment ago!
I've gotta think of a way to turn this around...!

name: Y'golonac
text:
I mean, that Baphomet is totally cheating!
Is she controlling the desire by giving it direction!?

name: Ryota
text:
Welcome! Welcome!
It's Patisserie Iimori's special poda pitha~!

name: Hei Long Yi Quan
text:
Look, everyone! I've never seen a dish like this before!
Is it pizza, or a cake...? But the ingredients are rice and beans!?

name: Y'golonac
text:
Hey, Ryota! You're on the Shibamata team, aren't you!?
Yi Quan, even you are... Why are you 'sending salt to the enemy'!?

敵に塩を送る (tekinishio wo okuru / sending salt to the enemy): Japanese idiom, helping one's rival in a time of need,
originating from Uesugi Kenshin sending salt to his rival Takeda Shingen during a shortage

name: Taishakuten
text:
I don't mind. If it livens up the place, then it's a success for the business!
But we have no intention of losing, right, Thunderbird!?

name: Thunderbird
text:
Right back at you, Taishakuten!
Let us unveil a sensational 'Flair Bartending' that will leave the customers stunned!

Seven cocktail 'tins' rest on Thunderbird's muscular arms.
He manipulates them skillfully, as if they were his own primary feathers.

When he signals with a wink, Taishakuten causes a small
lightning strike on the tins, igniting them with a crackle.

As the flaming juice is transferred from tin to tin and
poured into the glasses— Seven-colored flames flare up inside.

name: Y'golonac
text:
Look at him acting all cool! What's with the 'baby' thing?
His character overlaps way too much with Uncle's, from being cool to everything else!!

name: Tajikarao
text:
Y'golonac-dono, concentrate and don't look away!
If we get overwhelmed here, they'll finally catch up to us.

name: Oguchi Magami
text:
*sniff sniff*! It looks so delicious... *gulp*.
Please, customer, thank you for waiting... *drool*.

name: Specter
text:
Ah, ahaha... I-If you'd like,
would you like to eat together...?

name: Oguchi Magami
text:
Really!?
I'm so happy...
Ah, ouch!?

name: Tetsuya
text:
Like it's a matter of course...
Honestly, trying to blend in with us so casually.
Well, it is a festive occasion, so I'll let it slide for today.

The food stall booths are lively despite it being the final stretch.
And just then, appearing at the color gang stall—

name: Baphomet
text:
Oh, so you have come?
I am very happy that you have actually come to visit.

name: Kirito
text:
—So, what do you want? I doubt it,
but if you're asking me to help with the stall...

name: Color Gang
text:
—!? Kirito, is it really you!?
You came back for us—!?

name: Kirito
text:
...It's not for your sake.
Just tell me what you need, Baphomet-san.

name: Baphomet
text:
Actually— I do not know myself.
Could you explain it to us, Jagannath-sama?

name: Jagannath
text:
I'm the one who forced him back.
This guy was planning to disappear, after all.

name: Kirito
text:
...Hah???
What's that, it makes even less sense now?

name: Jagannath
text:
What, it's just what they call 'meddling where it's not needed'.
You wouldn't make a wish to Santa for yourself, would you?

name: Jagannath
text:
But you 'want to go back to your family' if possible.
Wouldn't it be okay to wish for that once in a while?

name: Jagannath
text:
You feel like 'you have no place in happiness'.
But, if Baphomet hadn't been in underground Ikebukuro—

name: Jagannath
text:
You would have stayed in underground Ikebukuro.
If that's not 'caring for your family', then what is?

name: Kirito
text:
—Huh?
...You're even more annoying than I imagined. Sorry, but I—

options.text: It'll be fun if we're together.
You've come all this way, so help out.
Are you admitting defeat?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Kirito
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...30 points.
Cheap provocation.
You've still got a long way to go.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Kirito
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Well, you two together make a pass.
Shall I show you what it's like to be the hated one?

name: Baphomet
text:
Please, for my sake.
...Even just a little bit will do.

name: Kirito
text:
...[Player]-san aside, you weren't that kind
of character. Just what has gotten into you?

name: Kirito
text:
...Fine. But it's a trade-off.
I'll disappear whenever I want to. If you can accept that.

name: Color Gang
text:
We did it!
With Kirito with us, we're a hundred times stronger!!

As if to confirm that powerful declaration, Kirito's participation
acted as an igniter, and the Ikebukuro stall gained even more momentum.

name: Y'golonac
text:
Uguu... Even more help!?
If Baphomet is getting serious, then Uncle won't lose either!

name: Y'golonac
text:
And of course, I won't lose to that 'character-overlapping traitor'!
If it's come to this, I have no choice but to use my trump card, right?

name: Y'golonac
text:
Hihihi, I'll secretly 'use' a forbidden ingredient from the Old Ones—
■■■■ to act as a secret flavor!!
Battle Start

name: Announcement
text:
The sales results will now be tallied.
Please wait a moment until the contest results are announced——!

The members of each team wait for the results,
feeling like they've done everything they could.

name: Color Gang
text:
Um... Choji, thanks.
Thanks to you, we were able to make a big comeback.

name: Choji
text:
Great work, everyone. I've baked some poda pitha for
everyone to eat together at the end. Please, do help yourselves.

name: Baphomet
text:
Oh, what a sweet and warm flavor...
It is no wonder this attracts people visiting the winter festival.

name: Kirito
text:
...It's true.
Good enough to be sold.

options.text: I'm glad it went well.
Nice team!!
I'm nervous about the results.

text:
Just as everyone felt that everything had gone well,
there was only one person who looked like they haven't had their fill yet.

name: Jagannath
text:
Heheh, the prank I've set up isn't over yet?
In fact, the real show starts now. The real reason I brought Kirito back is...

name: Hotei
text:
Now then, for the heated judging by the chefs has reached its midpoint,
we'll now move on to judging the top two teams in sales!

name: Hotei
text:
Alright, servers for the Ikebukuro team!
Please present your dishes to the three judges!

name: Kirito
text:
(...Shit. Jagannath, you better remember this.
Who could've guessed that Baphomet-san was so into it too?)

Now, Kirito perfectly understands.
Why he was brought back, and even forced into the role of a server.

Among the judges is a familiar face— Well, a helmet, to be precise.
Kirito 'presents' the dishes in an unfamiliar manner, his face looking down.

name: Ebisu
text:
Hmm. Both utilize the texture of the dough, but the level
of completion in both directions of sweet and savory was impressive!

name: Nisroch
text:
I see Iimori's 'boy' had a hand in this.
And, he's even modified the recipe so that anyone can mass-produce it.

name: Surtr
text:
Using the sugar to represent fallen snow, reproducing a fantastical winter landscape.
It is delicious whether it is hot or cold, a delicacy perfect for this season.

The children sigh in relief at the high praise,
which is no less than that of the previous dishes... But—

name: Surtr
text:
If you may pardon me.
Could I ask you just one question?

name: Surtr
text:
No. Not to the chef, but to the server there.
I'd like to ask what kind of feelings were put into this dish.

After saying that, Surtr waits in silence.
The attention of the host, the judges, and the teammates naturally focuses on Kirito.

name: Kirito
text:
...I'm just a server, so there's no way I'd know about the dish.
Why don't you go ask the chef?

name: Surtr
text:
However, you also had a hand in its making too, yes?
If so, you should surely know the feelings put into this dish.

He's good at disappearing, but it was proven to be
difficult in this situation. Kirito lets out a damp sigh.

name: Kirito
text:
...A collection of outcasts—
A dish made by an 'improvised pseudo-family'.

name: Kirito
text:
Those who have no place to go— No 'place they want to go back to',
made it together while feeling like they were a real family.

name: Kirito
text:
At first, it was a mess, but we slowly
deepened our unity and became one in our thoughts.

name: Kirito
text:
I don't know about the cooking, so it's just a guess...
But for them, it was probably something like that.

name: Surtr
text:
—I see, indeed. The warmth I felt in this dish
was like a small flame lit by those huddling together.

name: Surtr
text:
But while I am at it, there is one more thing.
Was this— a dish like that 'for you as well'?

A long and awkward silence ensues.
The next words carry the hardness of a resolution.

name: Kirito
text:
...A fragment of it might be.
However, my position is different from theirs.

name: Surtr
text:
—And that is?
If I may 'inquire'.

name: Kirito
text:
...It's not that I don't have a place to go back to.
It's just that I want to destroy happiness...
So that's not where I belong to.

name: Kirito
text:
But, that's all there is to it.
To be treated as part of their family, honestly feels—

name: Kirito
text:
—Well. I suppose, I do feel
a little bit bad for them.

name: Kirito
text:
...Despite having a 'place I can go back to if I want to',
I'm sure it looks like I'm just being spoiled.

A silence for 'reflection' ensues. What Surtr felt about
those words cannot be read from the gap in his helmet.

name: Surtr
text:
...Thank you.
I'm glad I could hear your story.

name: Kirito
text:
...It was nothing. Just make sure you
judge based on the content of the dish.

Kirito tries to leave, turning his stiff face
away out of embarrassment, but Surtr calls out to him.

name: Surtr
text:
I am deeply sorry, but just one more at the very end.
This is unrelated to the cooking, and is just my own hypothesis, but...

name: Surtr
text:
Your family— 'Your other family',
might also be wishing for you to return.

Kirito stops and turns back slowly.
The tension from before had vanished from his expression.

name: Kirito
text:
—Haha. Isn't there just too many people
making 'hypothetical cases' at this festival?

Kirito laughs brightly and steps down from the stage.
This time, Surtr did not stop him.

options.text: Jagannath, was this your plan?
I admit, that was a good prank.
How long have you been envisioning this?

name: Jagannath
text:
Heheh, why don't you learn how to handle business while you're having fun?
I'll explain it from the top so even you can follow along.

name: Jagannath
text:
The first thing I caught was information that the contest judges had
been changed just before the event. Surprisingly, the new judge was Surtr.

name: Jagannath
text:
Finding it strange, I dug a bit deeper and found that Surtr was
a member of the color gang—
In other words, he had some deep ties with Kirito.

name: Jagannath
text:
The rest you already know. I milked them for info,
read the room, and set the stage for everything to go down.
Not bad for a day's work, right?

options.text: Don't come crying to me if Kirito stabs you.
You're amazing, senior!
When did you get that far...!?

name: Jagannath
text:
Now, if those brats take first place,
it'll be perfect. Let's watch how it ends.

name: Y'golonac
text:
Hehehe, it's not that simple!
Watch, Uncle's finishing touch will blow you away~?

Where Y'golonac is looking—
On the stage, stands Tetsuya, serving for Kabukicho.

name: Tetsuya
text:
(...Tch. The 'food stalls' are one thing,
but this is definitely not my job.)

name: Tetsuya
text:
(...But even that Kirito did the
serving against his nature.)

name: Tetsuya
text:
(Knowing his personality, he would have disappeared quickly
if he didn't want to. So he's found a 'place to return to'...
With this, we're finally completely 'strangers'.)

Tetsuya raises the right corner of his mouth at an angle where no one can see,
and solemnly carries the dishes while being a server.

name: Nisroch
text:
Oh, this is a very provocative and violent dish.
However, there's something profound hidden deep inside.

name: Nisroch
text:
—Mm!
Th... This is—!!?

The venue after the cooking contest ended.
A few minutes after the results were announced—

name: Color Gang
text:
Haah, we lost by a hair.
The Kabukicho group captured the heart of the Chief Judge Nisroch.

name: Baphomet
text:
Fufu, but you look like you have done everything you could, did you not?
I feel the same, for there was a lot to be gained regardless of victory or defeat.

name: Y'golonac
text:
Gwahahaha! Sorry, brats. Uncle's quite a bad guy,
so Uncle's crushed you without reading the room!

name: Jinn
text:
To be able to go all out and crush them in
that situation, I even feel a sense of respect, Y'golonac...

name: Y'golonac
text:
Uncle hasn't given up on [Player] yet!
If Uncle left it like that, it would've ended up being a good feeling!

name: Choji
text:
I didn't think you'd actually use ■■■■.
It's a phantom item also called 'Spice of the Abyss'.

name: Choji
text:
Y'golonac-san, if it's okay with you...
Could you 'supply' some of it to me next time?

name: Y'golonac
text:
I don't mind, but I don't know what might just happen?
It's something beyond human control, and if handled incorrectly... Hihihi.

options.text: ...What did you put in it!?
Is that safe for consumption?
It looked delicious~

dialogue_after_selection.name: Y'golonac
dialogue_after_selection.text: Of course, [Player], I'll let you eat as much as you want, and I'll even feed you if need to!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Y'golonac
dialogue_after_selection.text:
That's it!
Uncle should have controlled your stomach from the beginning so you'd never leave Uncle!!

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Hmph. We lost, but it was a splendid fight.
Each group has undoubtedly climbed to the next stage!

name: Kirito
text:
...Jagannath.
You've really done it.

name: Jagannath
text:
Hehe, what are you talking about?
All I did was letting you get on stage as a representative of Ikebukuro?

Kirito is fed up with the unrepentant attitude.
In the subtle atmosphere, the children timidly interrupt.

name: Color Gang
text:
Hey, Kirito. Um...
That judge just now, could it be—

name: Kirito
text:
...Were you disappointed? Turns out, I actually have a place to belong.
Turns out, I'm different from you who lost your way and went into the streets.

He can't meet the eyes of the color gang members.
Disappointment, contempt... What kind of eyes are they looking at him with?

name: Color Gang
text:
No, it's... rather the opposite, right?
Because, you stayed with us despite having a place to belong to.

name: Color Gang
text:
And besides, if you say that, there are some among us who
just don't want to return regardless of the circumstances.

name: Kirito
text:
...It's not that.
I 'just don't want to be anywhere'.

As the Ripper of the Fog City once was,
Tachihara Kirito 'cannot help but erase his own footprints'.

It's not that he doesn't want to entrust his heart to someone.
It's just that the feeling of 'I shouldn't be here' was stronger than anything else.

name: Baphomet
text:
Even if that is the truth, it is not the only thing.
You have always cared for these children.

name: Jagannath
text:
That's why you let yourself get put on the floats,
and you show up when I set you up.
In short, you can't push them away completely.

name: Color Gang
text:
...Kirito, if you have a place to go back to, go back.
We might do the same... If we ever find one.

Kirito purses his lips tightly,
enduring the intense pain inside him.

name: Kirito
text:
The nature you're born with isn't always good.
I always want to destroy the groups I get deeply involved with.

There are people who hate their family more than anyone else.
I hate fools who can't even imagine that.

But, more than that— I hate myself,
so I end up hating anyone who loves me.

name: Baphomet
text:
—If you hate everyone in the world,
that is the same as loving everyone in the world, is it not?

name: Baphomet
text:
You say you hate yourself who is mysterious.
But, there is someone here that is just like you.

name: Baphomet
text:
In that way, we are like your family.
I will not deny that you hate yourself.

As 'I' look up, at the 'gentle pair of eyes' gazing at me―
'It makes me sick'. I wanted to say something like
I always have, but no words would escape my mouth.

name: Baphomet
text:
I think— I understand how you feel.
It is almost painful...

name: Baphomet
text:
There were those who were held accountable for carrying me.
I am only afraid to imagine the same thing happening again.

name: Baphomet
text:
But— Regardless of whether we can or
cannot, let us give it a try together.

name: Jagannath
text:
That's Karma Yoga for you!
Don't be attached to the results, just take action!

name: Color Gang
text:
We'll do our best not to break things.
We'll all protect one of your places to belong to, Kirito.

name: Color Gang
text:
Even if you decide to go back, or if everyone
gets separated one day, we'll always be a 'family'.
You can have as many in-law families as you want!

name: Kirito
text:
...How can you say that so casually?
It's so naive, even to the point of—

In his mind are the faces of those who could be called 'family'.
And— Before him is another who wants to call him family.

name: Kirito
text:
...This feeling might disappear by tomorrow anyway.
So I guess I can give my true nature a rest for today.

name: Jagannath
text:
Now, Baphomet. Surely you don't think you can 'only'
be a temporary place to belong anymore, do you?

name: Jagannath
text:
When you are great at what you 'can do',
and that someone else can fill in for what you 'can't do'—
You want to teach that those brats too, don't you?

name: Baphomet
text:
Yes, I was arrogant.
Kirito-sama turned out to be much more than I thought—

name: Jagannath
text:
Anyway, today you've moved without thinking.
